title: Traffic Advisory: Route Changes in Belagavi for Congress Session Centenary on 26th and 27th December 2024 - AllAboutBelgaum
Rajasthan man takes voluntary retirement to care for wife, she dies at his farewell party. Video - Hindustan Times
summary:
Rajasthan Man's Farewell Party Turns Tragic as Wife Dies Suddenly

Date: Dec 26, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A farewell party for Devendra Sandal, a government employee in Rajasthan, turned tragic when his wife, Deepika, collapsed and died in front of him. The couple was celebrating Devendra's voluntary retirement aimed at caring for Deepika, who had heart issues.

  • Devendra took early retirement to care for his 50-year-old wife, who had been suffering from heart-related problems.
  • The incident occurred at Devendra's farewell party at the Central Warehouse in Kota.
  • A video of the event has been shared on social media, capturing the moment before the tragedy unfolded.
  • Deepika showed signs of discomfort during the function, which led to her collapse.
  • Despite immediate attempts to help her, she was declared dead upon arrival at the hospital.
“Paani le aao, chakkar aa rahe honge.” (bring water, she might be feeling dizzy)

This heartbreaking incident highlights the unpredictability of life and the suddenness of loss, serving as a poignant reminder of the fragility of health.
newTitle: Rajasthan Man's Farewell Party Turns Tragic as Wife Dies Suddenly

title: Maharashtra Contract Employee Stole Rs 21 Crore From Govt; Bought BMW, Gifted 4BHK To Girlfriend - News18
summary:
Maharashtra Contract Employee Stole Rs 21 Crore From Govt; Bought BMW, Gifted 4BHK To Girlfriend

Date: December 25, 2024
Source: News18

A government contractual employee in Maharashtra allegedly defrauded Rs 21 crore from the sports complex administration, using forged documents and internet banking. This scandal led to an extravagant lifestyle that left acquaintances bewildered.

  • The accused, Harsh Kumar Kshirsagar, was on a salary of Rs 13,000.
  • Kshirsagar and an accomplice misappropriated government funds through an internet banking scheme.
  • They purchased luxury items including a BMW car and gifted a 4 BHK flat to Kshirsagar's girlfriend.
  • Investigations revealed the involvement of other contract employees in the fraudulent activity.
  • The scam was discovered six months after it began.
"The departmental deputy director only detected the fraudulent activity six months later."

This incident highlights the vulnerabilities within government systems, prompting calls for stricter controls and audits to prevent such occurrences in the future.
newTitle: Maharashtra Contract Employee Stole Rs 21 Crore From Govt; Bought BMW, Gifted 4BHK To Girlfriend

title: PM Modi launches Ken-Betwa link project, hails Ambedkar vision - The Times of India
summary:
PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa Link Project, Celebrates Ambedkar's Vision

Publication Date: March 2023 • Source: The Times of India

The Ken-Betwa link project aims to improve water availability in Madhya Pradesh, promoting sustainable development while honoring B.R. Ambedkar's vision for holistic progress.

  • PM Modi inaugurated the Ken-Betwa link project on March 18, 2023.
  • The project is expected to benefit thousands of farmers in the region.
  • This initiative is part of a larger plan to interlink rivers in India for better water management.
  • Modi emphasized the importance of Ambedkar's ideals in nation-building.
"This project embodies Ambedkar's vision for equality and development for all segments of society." - PM Narendra Modi

The Ken-Betwa link project represents a significant step towards addressing water scarcity and enhancing agricultural productivity, in line with Ambedkar's legacy.
newTitle: PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa Link Project, Celebrates Ambedkar's Vision

NDA Leaders Unite to Address Congress' Criticism in Strategic Meeting

Source: Times of India

This meeting aimed to consolidate strategies among NDA leaders as they plan to counter the recent criticisms stemming from the Congress party's comments regarding Dr. B.R. Ambedkar.

  • NDA leaders convened to discuss a unified response to Congress' recent Ambedkar-related statements.
  • Strategies were outlined to enhance communication and public image in light of the criticisms.

'We must speak in a united voice to ensure our message reaches the public effectively.'

title: Mumbai: Stopped for blocking vehicles on road, man attacks policeman with stick; injures him - Hindustan Times
summary:
Man Attacks Policeman with Stick in Mumbai After Blocking Traffic

Date: Dec 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

An Assistant Sub-Inspector was injured in an attack while attempting to clear a traffic obstruction in Mumbai.

  • The incident occurred on Tuesday when the officer noticed a traffic jam.
  • Upon getting out of the police van, he confronted a man blocking the road.
  • The man attacked ASI Manik Sawant with a stick, causing head injuries.
  • Sawant lost consciousness and was taken to Tunga Hospital, where he recovered.
  • The assailant, identified as Arun Harijan, fled the scene, and a case of attempted murder has been filed.
“The accused fled the scene, leaving the stick behind.”

This incident highlights a growing concern about violence against traffic officers in urban areas.
newTitle: Man Attacks Policeman with Stick in Mumbai After Blocking Traffic

title: AIMIM plans to field 2020 Delhi riots accused Shahrukh Pathan, who pointed gun at cops, in assembly polls - Hindustan Times
summary:
AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) is contemplating the candidacy of Shahrukh Pathan, an accused from the 2020 Delhi riots, for the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Shahrukh Pathan has been in Tihar jail since March 2020 for his role in the riots.
  • His candidacy is not yet finalized, according to AIMIM sources.
  • AIMIM's Delhi unit intends to contest 12 assembly seats.
  • The assembly elections are scheduled for February next year, amidst a competitive political landscape in Delhi.
“Pathan’s name is being considered for candidacy, but no official decision has been made.” - Shoaib Jamei, AIMIM’s Delhi unit president

The potential nomination of Shahrukh Pathan highlights AIMIM's strategy in the forthcoming elections and raises significant questions about candidate selection amid ongoing legal challenges.
newTitle: AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

title: Bangladesh drops another shocker, threatens action against India if Modi govt refuses to... - India.com
summary:
Bangladesh Threatens Action Against India Over Sheikh Hasina Extradition

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: India.com

Bangladesh has announced that it is waiting for a response from India regarding the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. The foreign ministry has issued a formal request and stated that they will take further action if India does not reply soon.

  • Bangladesh sent a diplomatic note to India on December 23 but has not yet received a response.
  • A 'note of urgency' will be issued if India fails to respond within a certain period.
  • No specific timeline exists for the extradition process between the two countries.
  • The spokesperson for Bangladesh stressed that the country is willing to wait but will not hesitate to act further.
"If India does not respond on the issue in an appropriate period of time, Bangladesh will take further steps to ensure Hasina’s extradition." - Mohammed Rafiqul Alam

In conclusion, Bangladesh's threats of diplomatic action highlight the tension surrounding the extradition request of Sheikh Hasina and could escalate if responses from India remain pending.
newTitle: Bangladesh Threatens Action Against India Over Sheikh Hasina Extradition

YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia & GF Saved By IPS Officers Family From Drowning At Goa Beach: We Got Swept Away - Free Press Journal
summary:
YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and Girlfriend Rescued from Drowning at Goa Beach

Published on: December 25, 2024, Source: Instagram

Popular YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia, known as “Beer Biceps,” recounts a terrifying drowning experience in Goa with his rumored girlfriend, actress Nikki Sharma, during a swim.

  • The incident happened on Christmas Eve as they were swept away by a strong underwater current.
  • Ranveer, who is an experienced swimmer, struggled to save both himself and Nikki.
  • They were rescued by a nearby family, including an IPS officer and his wife.
  • Ranveer expressed immense gratitude for the rescue, calling it a life-changing experience.
  • The incident has fueled speculation about Ranveer and Nikki's relationship.
“We felt the protection of God throughout the incident. Almost feel like this one life experience has changed my perspective towards living.”

In conclusion, the couple emerged from a near-fatal experience with a renewed appreciation for life and a message of gratitude.
newTitle: YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia and Girlfriend Rescued from Drowning at Goa Beach

title: PM Modi to distribute 58 lakh property cards under scheme to digitise rural property records - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi to Distribute 58 Lakh Property Cards Under Rural Digitization Scheme

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will distribute 58 lakh property cards under the Svamitva scheme to digitize property records in rural areas, benefitting over 50,000 villages across 12 States.

  • The distribution event will have at least 13 Union Ministers addressing various locations.
  • The Svamitva scheme aims to record property rights, facilitate property monetization, and aid in community development.
  • Approximately 2.19 crore property cards have been finalized so far.
  • The scheme has seen 92% of drone mapping completed for targeted villages.
  • The targets of the scheme are expected to be achieved by 2026.
“The scheme has helped women establish their ownership and facilitated better planning for community development.”

This initiative represents a significant step towards digitizing rural property rights and improving the socio-economic conditions of rural populations.
newTitle: PM Modi to Distribute 58 Lakh Property Cards Under Rural Digitization Scheme

One tourist dead, 12 rescued after sports water boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach - The Indian Express
summary:
One tourist dead, 12 rescued after sports water boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

Date: Wednesday, Source: Coastal Police

A tragic incident occurred off Calangute beach in North Goa, where a 45-year-old tourist from Maharashtra died and 12 others were rescued after a boat capsized.

  • The incident happened at around 12.30 pm.
  • The boat was carrying a driver, helper, and 11 members of a family from Maharashtra’s Ratnagiri district.
  • The boat capsized about 70 meters from the shore due to alleged motor malfunction.
  • All 13 passengers were rescued and taken to a health center; one was declared dead on arrival.
  • The deceased was identified as Suryakant Pophalkar, aged 45.
  • Police have initiated inquest proceedings to investigate potential negligence.
  • Conflicting accounts suggest the boat may have been overloaded and lacked life jackets for some passengers.
“According to preliminary information, the boat was about 70 metres from the coastline when its motor is alleged to have malfunctioned, following which it flipped and was swept by waves.” - Police Officer

This incident calls attention to water safety regulations and the need for stringent oversight in tourist boating operations.
newTitle: One tourist dead, 12 rescued after sports water boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

title: One tourist dead, 12 rescued after boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach - The Indian Express
summary:
One tourist dead, 12 rescued after sports water boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

Date: Wednesday, Source: Coastal Police

A tragic incident occurred off Calangute beach in North Goa, where a 45-year-old tourist from Maharashtra died and 12 others were rescued after a boat capsized.

  • The incident happened at around 12.30 pm aboard a ‘watersports’ boat carrying a family from Maharashtra’s Ratnagiri district.
  • The boat was about 70 metres from the coastline when the motor allegedly malfunctioned, causing it to capsize.
  • All passengers were rescued and taken to a primary health centre; however, one was declared dead on arrival.
  • The deceased was identified as Suryakant Pophalkar, 45, from Khed in Ratnagiri.
  • Some passengers claim the boat was overloaded, and one did not have a life jacket.
“The boat’s motor suddenly stopped working, due to which it capsized.” - Antony Coutinho, boat owner

This incident raises concerns about safety protocols in tourist watersports, prompting police investigations for potential negligence.
newTitle: One tourist dead, 12 rescued after sports water boat capsizes off Goa’s Calangute beach

title: Judicial officer suspended for allegedly outraging modesty of woman court employee - The Hindu
summary:
Judicial officer suspended for allegedly outraging modesty of woman court employee

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

M. Suhaib, an Additional District Judge in Kozhikode, has been suspended following allegations of misconduct involving a woman court employee. This decision was taken after an emergency meeting of the Administrative Committee of the Kerala High Court, led by Chief Justice Nitin Madhukar Jamdar, which deemed the allegations as damaging to the credibility of the judiciary.

  • The incident reportedly took place in the judge's official chamber.
  • The court received an oral apology from the judge towards the woman involved.
  • The woman has been reluctant to file a formal complaint, complicating potential legal actions.
  • The judicial officer will be issued a show cause notice regarding his conduct.
  • This case has raised concerns among the legal community regarding the judiciary's integrity.
“The alleged incident has dented the credibility of the judicial institution of the State.”

This incident highlights ongoing challenges within institutional frameworks regarding accountability and the handling of misconduct allegations.
newTitle: Judicial Officer Suspended Over Allegations of Misconduct

title: Need to counter Congress on Ambedkar: BJP to allies; TDP for Opp-like coordination - The Indian Express
summary:
BJP Allies Meet to Unite Against Congress on Ambedkar Narrative

Publication Date: Wednesday
Source: Indian Express

The ruling NDA coalition convened to strategize against Congress's narrative regarding Dr. B R Ambedkar and the Constitution amidst controversies sparked by Home Minister Amit Shah's remarks.

  • The meeting was held at BJP President J P Nadda's residence in New Delhi.
  • Key discussions focused on countering opposition narratives surrounding Ambedkar and the caste census.
  • The TDP emphasized the need for better coordination among NDA allies.
  • The BJP leaders criticized Congress for manipulating Shah's remarks to mislead the public.
  • NDA leaders called for showcasing the government's contributions towards honoring Ambedkar and empowering Dalits.
  • The meeting occurred ahead of a significant Congress Working Committee meeting aimed at mobilizing against BJP's policies.
“The Congress is trying to create false narratives,” Amit Shah allegedly stated during the meeting.

The NDA is emphasizing unity and proactive communication to counter the upcoming offensive from the Congress regarding the issues surrounding Ambedkar and social justice.
newTitle: BJP Allies Meet to Unite Against Congress on Ambedkar Narrative

title: LIVE | Nagaland Lottery Sambad WEDNESDAY (25.12.2024): Dear PELICAN NIGHT 8 PM Lucky Draw Declared - 1st Prize - ABP Live
Vineet Joshi called back after yr and a half as Manipur chief secy, appointed higher education secy - ThePrint
summary:
Vineet Joshi Returns as Higher Education Secretary After Manipur Chief Secretary Role

Date & Source: New Delhi

A day after the appointment of Ajay Kumar Bhalla as Manipur's governor, the Centre has recalled Vineet Joshi, who served as the chief secretary in Manipur during a tumultuous period, and appointed him as the higher education secretary.

Key Points:

  • Vineet Joshi, a 1992 batch Manipur cadre officer, was appointed to manage riots in Manipur.
  • Joshi took over as chief secretary on May 7, 2022, shortly after the onset of ethnic violence.
  • His prior role involved leading the National Testing Agency responsible for entrance exams.
  • There has been ongoing ethnic conflict in Manipur, impacting the state's stability.
  • Violence has resulted in over 300 deaths and the displacement of over 60,000 individuals.
  • Joshi has experience in the education ministry and holds an IIT Kanpur degree and a PhD.
“There has been no let-up in the situation in the state. Nor has there been any substantial outreach from the state administration to bring the leaders of the two communities for talk.”

Conclusion: Joshi's return to Delhi as higher education secretary raises questions about future plans for restoring stability in Manipur amidst ongoing ethnic tensions.
newTitle: Vineet Joshi Returns as Higher Education Secretary After Manipur Chief Secretary Role

title: Kerala: Man narrowly escapes as train speeds over him in Kannur - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kerala Man Survives Train Incident in Kannur

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A viral video captured a man in Kerala's Kannur district narrowly escaping an oncoming train by lying flat on the tracks. Identified as 56-year-old Pavithran, he remained unharmed as the train passed over him.

  • The incident occurred around 5 pm between Kannur and Chirakkal railway stations.
  • Pavithran was talking on his phone and didn't notice the train until it was too late.
  • His quick action to lie down on the tracks saved his life.
  • Rumors spread about him being drunk, which he denied, explaining he did this to survive.
“I still haven’t recovered from the fear,” Pavithran stated.

The incident has drawn widespread attention on social media, and railway police confirmed his account.
newTitle: Kerala Man Survives Train Incident in Kannur

title: Second-year Anna University student sexually assaulted by two men on campus; One arrested - The New Indian Express
summary:
Anna University Student Allegedly Raped on Campus; One Arrested

Published on: 25 Dec 2024, 1:27 pm

CHENNAI: A second-year student of Anna University was allegedly raped by two men inside the campus on Monday night, prompting police action.

The incident sparked protests and raised concerns over campus security.

  • The assault occurred when the victim and her male friend were in a secluded area of the campus.
  • One suspect, Gnanasekaran, a 37-year-old biriyani vendor, was arrested on December 25.
  • The incident took place around 8 pm on December 23.
  • The victim has filed a complaint with the University's POSH committee.
  • Police are collaborating with the University to improve security measures.
Police have not yet made a comment on the incident.

This tragic event emphasizes the urgent need for enhanced safety measures on university campuses.
newTitle: Anna University Student Allegedly Raped on Campus; One Arrested
